### Third Qualitative Variable
Notes:

```{r Third Qualitative Variable}
library(ggplot2)
pf <- read.csv('pseudo_facebook.tsv', sep = '\t')
ggplot(aes(x = gender, y = age),
       data = subset(pf, !is.na(gender))) + geom_boxplot() + 
  stat_summary(fun.y = mean, geom = "point", share = 4)


ggplot(aes(x = age, y = friend_count), 
       data = subset(pf, !is.na(gender))) + 
  geom_line(aes(color = gender), stat = "summary", fun.y = median) # nice


library(dplyr)
age_gender_group <- group_by(pf, age, gender)
pf.fc_by_age_gender <- summarise(age_gender_group, 
                                 mean_friend_count = mean(friend_count), 
                                 median_friend_count = median(friend_count),
                                 n = n())
head(pf.fc_by_age_gender) #group by with dplyr package. 

#chain functions 
pf.fc_by_age_gender <- pf %>% 
  filter(!is.na(gender)) %>%
  group_by(age, gender) %>% 
  summarise(mean_friend_count = mean(friend_count), 
            median_friend_count = median(friend_count), 
            n = n()) %>% 
  ungroup() %>%
  arrange(age)
head(pf.fc_by_age_gender)

```

```{r Plotting Conditional Summaries}

              data = subset(pf.fc_by_age_gender)) + 
  geom_line(aes(color = gender)) #this plot makes use of the dplyr package where we have created a mean_friend_count


```

### Third Quantitative Variable
Notes:

```{r Third Quantitative Variable}
pf$year_joined <- floor(2014 - pf$tenure/365)

summary(pf$year_joined)
table(pf$year_joined)
```

***

### Cut a Variable
Notes:

```{r Cut a Variable}
?cut  
table(cut(pf$year_joined, breaks = 4))
pf$year_joined.bucket <- cut(pf$year_joined, c(2004,2009,2011,2012,2014))
table(pf$year_joined.bucket)
```

***

### Plotting it All Together
Notes:

```{r Plotting it All Together}

ggplot(aes(x = age, y = friend_count),

```

### Friendships Initiated
Notes:

What is the median friend rate?

What is the maximum friend rate?

```{r Friendships Initiated}
ggplot(aes( x = tenure, y = friendships_initiated / tenure), 
        data = subset(pf, tenure >= 1)) + 
  geom_line(aes(color = year_joined.bucket), stat = "summary", fun.y = mean)
```

***

### Bias-Variance Tradeoff Revisited
Notes:

```{r Bias-Variance Tradeoff Revisited}

p1 <- ggplot(aes(x = tenure, y = friendships_initiated / tenure),
       data = subset(pf, tenure >= 1)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = year_joined.bucket),
            stat = 'summary',
            fun.y = mean)

p2 <- ggplot(aes(x = 7 * round(tenure / 7), y = friendships_initiated / tenure),
       data = subset(pf, tenure > 0)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = year_joined.bucket),
            stat = "summary",
            fun.y = mean)

p3 <- ggplot(aes(x = 30 * round(tenure / 30), y = friendships_initiated / tenure),
       data = subset(pf, tenure > 0)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = year_joined.bucket),
            stat = "summary",
            fun.y = mean)

p4 <- ggplot(aes(x = 90 * round(tenure / 90), y = friendships_initiated / tenure),
       data = subset(pf, tenure > 0)) +
  geom_line(aes(color = year_joined.bucket),
            stat = "summary",
            fun.y = mean)
library(gridExtra)
grid.arrange(p1, p2,p3,p4,ncol = 1)

#geom smooth 

ggplot(aes(x = 7*round(tenure / 7), y = friendships_initiated / tenure), 
       data = subset(pf, tenure >= 1)) + 
  geom_smooth(aes(color = year_joined.bucket)) #smooths the graph. 
```

### Looking at Samples of Households

```{r Looking at Sample of Households}
ggplot(aes(x = time, y = price), 
       xlab = "time", 
       ylab = "price", 
       data = yo) + geom_jitter(color = 'blue', shape = 21, alpha = .05)
str(yo)
?ggplot

#set the reproducible results
set.seed(4230)
sample.ids <- sample(levels(yo$id), 16)


#plot 
ggplot(aes(x = time, y = price), 
       data = subset(yo, id %in% sample.ids)) + 
  facet_wrap(~ id) + 
  geom_line() + 
  geom_point(aes(size = all.purchases, color = all.purchases), pch = 1)



#Set a different seed
set.seed(2356)
sample.ids <- sample(levels(yo$id), 16)

ggplot(aes(x = time, y = price), 
       data = subset(yo, id %in% sample.ids)) + 
  facet_wrap(~ id) + 
  geom_line() + 
  geom_point(aes(size = all.purchases, color = all.purchases), pch = 1)
```
